FuncDef:
The remark mpls-exp command re-marks the EXP value of MPLS packets.
The undo remark mpls-exp command cancels the configuration.
By default, re-marking the EXP value of MPLS packets is not configured in traffic behavior view.

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies the EXP value of MPLS packets.
The value is an integer ranging from 0 to 7.

ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
You can run this command to re-mark the EXP value of MPLS packets.
Prerequisites
The traffic behavior is configured.
Follow-up Procedure
The traffic policy is configured and the policy is applied to interfaces.
Precautions
If the remark mpls-exp command is run repeatedly in the same traffic behavior view, the later configuration overrides the previous one.
The remark mpls-exp command can be applied to only inbound traffic on a P device.
This command re-marks only the outermost label of packets.
